name: Texas Caviar
description: Marinated for days with jalapeños, scallions and cilantro, black-eyed peas become “Texas caviar,” a spicy, tangy (if sloppy) dip for tortilla chips.
keywords: black-eyed peas, jalapeño, side dish, vegan, vegetarian, winter
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the peas well, rinse under running water and drain again. Transfer to a bowl. Add the scallions, jalapeños and cilantro and toss to mix. Whisk together the oil, lime juice and vinegar and pour over the beans. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer to a large glass jar or airtight plastic container. Marinate the mixture for three to five days, turning the jar occasionally to mix the ingredients.
To serve, spoon the peas into a shallow glass bowl. Serve with chips for scooping.
